data.text: She prospered their works in the hand of the holy prophet.
They went through the wilderness that was not inhabited,
They stood against their enemies, and were avenged of their adversaries.
When they were thirsty, they called upon thee,
For by what things their enemies were punished,
For instead of a fountain of a perpetual running river
For a manifest reproof of that commandment, whereby the infants were slain,
Declaring by that thirst then how
For when they were tried, albeit but in mercy chastised,
For these thou didst admonish and try, as a father:
Whether they were absent or present, they were vexed alike.
For a double grief came upon them,
For when they heard by their own punishments the other to be benefited,
For whom they rejected with scorn, when he was long before thrown out at the casting forth of the infants,
But for the foolish devices of their wickedness,
That they might know, that wherewithal a man sinneth, by the same shall he be punished.
For thy Almighty hand,
Or unknown wild beasts, full of rage, newly created,
Whereof not only the harm might dispatch them at once,
Yea, and without these might they have fallen down with one blast,
For thou canst show thy great strength at all times when thou wilt;
For the whole world before thee is as a little grain of the balance,
But thou hast mercy upon all; for thou canst do all things,
For thou lovest all the things that are,
And how could anything have endured, if it had not been thy will?
But thou sparest all: for they are thine, O Lord, thou lover of souls.
